results.title: The Nature of anthropology
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Faces of culture”.
Every man and woman has a story to tell which is finally the story of us all. The basic tenet of modern anthropology is that people are fundamentally alike but different and that all cultures are valid approaches to answering the question of who and what we are. Of the two major strands of anthropology - physical and cultural, this series is primarily concerned with cultural anthropology. Narrated by David Carradine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams and Coast Community College District

results.title: Mimi pulka
results.creator_credit: Catherine Adams, Ruth Carr, SBS-TV and Voice Productions
results.brief_description: In an effort to break down existing myths about HIV/AIDS and present the information in a way that was culturally appropriate for First Nations peoples, the Kimberley Aboriginal Medical Service in Broome commissioned a play entitled “No prejudice” and sent it on tour throughout the Kimberley region. This video follows the touring company of five actors and advisers and highlights the importance of why alternatives to the written word are necessary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Adams, Ruth Carr, SBS-TV and Voice Productions

results.title: Anzac
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Historical photographs and early newsreels tell the story of the Gallipoli assault; embarkation and transport of 75,000 men in 200 ships from Egypt to Gallipoli; initial landing below cliffs; building a jetty and digging in; main British attack at Cape Helles and subsequent assaults on the heights; hardships, casualties and final evacuation. Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films

Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.

results.title: Women of the iron frontier
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video
results.brief_description: Filmed in the remote Pilbara region in far north Western Australia this is a moving revelation of the struggle of women who are trying to create a life for themselves in the hostile environment of outback iron ore mining towns. “Time goes very slowly” deals with the problems of isolation and unemployment for women in Newman. “It’s not a community anymore” tells of the ongoing effects of the bitter 1986 Robe River industrial dispute upon families in the town of Wickham. “It’s supposed to be a town” explores racism through the eyes of both the black and white women of Newman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video

results.title: [Brookes Family Home Movies: Reel 9]
results.brief_description:
This film shows a schoolboy game of cricket being played on the turf wicket in the grounds of the Glamorgan Preparatory School in Toorak, Victoria. Glamorgan is the Toorak campus of the Geelong Grammar School in Geelong Victoria. The boys wear Geelong Grammar school caps. Behind the cricket pitch we can see the rooftops and chimneys of the grand homes of Toorak. There is a colourfully painted wall behind the cricketers depicting a scene of Governor Phillip raising the flag at Sydney Cove in 1788. A hand painted didactic says:
“Governor Phillip brought the First Fleet to anchor at Botany Bay but raised the flag at Sydney Cove January 26th 1788. This was the first Australia Day.”

We see the Glamorgan Vs Visitors scoreboard, runs being made, catches being taken and 4s being scored.

The film then takes us to a suburban backyard to show a young baby on a rug. There is some lovely footage of the baby trying to crawl, wearing a handmade necklace made from wooden cotton reels. The baby shares the backyard with other children who play on climbing equipment and engage with the baby.

We see a toddler dressed in rompers standing inside a playpen. The toddler pushes the playpen along from the inside, walking out onto a verandah. There is some delightful footage of a baby crawling along a garden path and playing in a container of water.

The film shows children playing and swimming in an above ground backyard swimming pool. They have kickboards and rubber rings which could be bicycle tyres. They take turns somersaulting into the water from the edge of the pool. After finishing swimming, and wrapped in towels, the children eat drum-stick style ice creams.

This film shows good examples of family at-home recreation and play equipment, including climbing equipment and a swimming pool. There are also examples of suburban architecture, children’s and babies’ fashion, baby paraphernalia such as a playpen, school sports playing fields and turf cricket.

This film was originally made on 16mm.

Selected highlights list:
00:01:25:00 School cricket match with painted Australia Day/Governor Phillip scene behind
00:03:52:00 Glamorgan score board
00:05:21:00 School boys playing cricket, umpire (teacher) and painted wall behind
00:06:50:00 Baby with necklace of wooden cotton reels
00:09:08:00 Toddler inside playpen, walking out onto the verandah
00:09:28:00 Toddler crawls across the verandah
00:10:51:00 Toddler in rompers crawling along a garden path to play in container of water
00:14:01:00 Children playing in backyard pool

results.title: [Brookes Family Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
This film shows a family ski trip to Falls Creek. We see the interior and exterior of the Winterhaven Ski Lodge and children being towed along by a ski tow. There are closeups and wide shots of skiers as they navigate their way around what appears to be a beginner’s ski run.

The film shows a children’s group ski lesson, a poma and T-bar lift, children skiing towards the camera and people being towed up the slope by the Village T-Bar ski tow. The children learn to ‘hop’ and the signal for ‘follow me’.

We see an adult couple preparing to ski with what appears to be a 1950s/1960s Volkswagen Beetle and pick-up truck parked in the background.

There are some lovely snow-covered landscapes of Falls Creek with people skiing in the sunshine against the backdrop of a bright blue sky.

A Snow Cat (vehicle) drives through the snow, passing ski lodges on the way.

A teenage boy runs beside a creek at the foot of a snow-covered embankment. We see a fishing expedition to the same creek, where fishing rods are prepared with bait and tackle, and two men and a boy cast their rods into the creek.

On the deck of Winterhaven Lodge, a group of people wearing shorts, swimwear and sunglasses lie on sun lounges enjoying the winter sun with the snow-covered embankment behind them. A woman wearing a bikini lies on a sun lounge beside her male companion who smokes and reads a book. Both are sporting 1960s sunglasses in the winter sun. We see a view from the deck of the ski lodge, showing snow-covered hills and surrounding ski lodges below.

The final section of the film follows a lone skier as he traverses his way down an empty slope.

This film shows good examples of fashion, ski wear, swimwear and sunglasses worn in the 60s. Ski Lodge architecture, vehicles and Falls Creek landscapes in this film are also a great reflection of the era.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 Film title: “Falls Creek 1962”
00:03:20:00 Father and son in tandem being pulled together on a tow rope
00:09:37:00 Ski School lesson with children
00:09:54:00 Man and woman preparing to ski with Volkswagen Beetle and c1950s pick-up truck parked in the background. Good fashion and vehicle example here
00:11:06:00 Wide shot of four skiers skiing down a slope
00:19:28:00 High shot taken from ski lodge of boy with skis with a snow-covered sunbed in the background
00:19:35:00 Vintage Snow Cat (vehicle) travels through the snow with dogs following, passing ski lodges along the way
00:22:06:00 Skiers and the landscape of Falls Creek
00:22:23:00 Snow and creek vista
00:22:45:00 Boy playing beside creek in the snow
00:23:54:00 Creek snow fishing expedition
00:25:48:00 People lounging in sun beds at the ski lodge, dressed in shorts, swimwear and sunglasses
00:26:02:00 View from the deck of the ski lodge showing snow-covered hills and lodges below
00:26:10:00 Woman lying on sun lounge wearing a bikini and eating an orange
00:26:21:00 Man lying on sun lounge smoking and reading a book
00:26:51:00 View of snow-covered hills and lodges
00:27:28:00 A lone skier skis down an empty slope

A teenage boy runs beside a creek at the foot of a snow-covered embankment. We see a fishing expedition to the same creek, where fishing rods are prepared with bait and tackle, and two men and a boy cast their rods into the creek.

On the deck of Winterhaven Lodge, a group of people wearing shorts, swimwear and sunglasses lie on sun lounges enjoying the winter sun with the snow-covered embankment behind them. A woman wearing a bikini lies on a sun lounge beside her male companion who smokes and reads a book. Both are sporting 1960s sunglasses in the winter sun. We see a view from the deck of the ski lodge, showing snow-covered hills and surrounding ski lodges below.

The final section of the film follows a lone skier as he traverses his way down an empty slope.

This film shows good examples of fashion, ski wear, swimwear and sunglasses worn in the 60s. Ski Lodge architecture, vehicles and Falls Creek landscapes in this film are also a great reflection of the era.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 Film title: “Falls Creek 1962”
00:03:20:00 Father and son in tandem being pulled together on a tow rope
00:09:37:00 Ski School lesson with children
00:09:54:00 Man and woman preparing to ski with Volkswagen Beetle and c1950s pick-up truck parked in the background. Good fashion and vehicle example here
00:11:06:00 Wide shot of four skiers skiing down a slope
00:19:28:00 High shot taken from ski lodge of boy with skis with a snow-covered sunbed in the background
00:19:35:00 Vintage Snow Cat (vehicle) travels through the snow with dogs following, passing ski lodges along the way
00:22:06:00 Skiers and the landscape of Falls Creek
00:22:23:00 Snow and creek vista
00:22:45:00 Boy playing beside creek in the snow
00:23:54:00 Creek snow fishing expedition
00:25:48:00 People lounging in sun beds at the ski lodge, dressed in shorts, swimwear and sunglasses
00:26:02:00 View from the deck of the ski lodge showing snow-covered hills and lodges below
00:26:10:00 Woman lying on sun lounge wearing a bikini and eating an orange
00:26:21:00 Man lying on sun lounge smoking and reading a book
00:26:51:00 View of snow-covered hills and lodges
00:27:28:00 A lone skier skis down an empty slope

results.title: [Brookes Family Home Movies: Reel 8]
results.brief_description:
The notes accompanying this film indicate that the footage is taken while on holiday in Queensland in 1955.

This film opens with rural landscape scenes of lush vegetation with mountains in the background. We see pine trees, fence posts and wire as well as a small out-house type construction made of wood with a corrugated iron roof. It could be an outdoor toilet.

There is footage of various varieties of tropical fish including butterfly fish, and varieties of coral including brain coral and large shells. These scenes appear to be shot through glass, so they could be at an Aquarium or on a glass-bottomed boat.

We see scenes of a whale watching expedition, with the top of a whale just visible above the water. There is also some water ski action which seems to be taking place on a dam or weir.

Originally made using 16mm film.
